result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Edwardo Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond Edwardo Torres

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond Edwardo Torres in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Raymond Edwardo Torres in custody.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
As to count 1:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 66 days served.
As to count 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for -0- days time served.   Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 16 months with the following conditions:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the agent and until the defendant has completed 1/2 of the batterer's treatment classes.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges as to both counts, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Raymond Edwardo Torres in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: 
Defendant had a positive drug test today for cocaine.  
DEFENDANT REMANDED FOR SENTENCING.
Defendant taken into custody.

Defendant Raymond Edwardo Torres in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for a plea and sentencing today.
As to both counts:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Defense is requesting an adjournment of the sentencing.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Raymond Edwardo Torres in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense has discovery and an offer. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM036251  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/23/2015

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Raymond Edwardo Torres not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case set for a Status Conference to branch 23  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Maria S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Raymond Edwardo Torres in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Raymond Edwardo Torres in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
